title: Communications and discussion with Lowfield Primary about London Rd/Broadfield Rd road widening

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide details of all consultations, communications and any discussions (letters/emails/meeting minutes etc.) that SCC has had with Lowfield Primary School or those connected to Lowfield (governors, head, individuals, including any parents or other interested parties) about the road widening scheme at London Rd/Broadfield Rd and about impacts/mitigations to be put in place (given Lowfield is ‘the most polluted school in Sheffield’).
Please note the inception of this road widening scheme goes back to 2017 so the search should go back to then.
Yours faithfully,
Ruth Hubbard

Dear Ruth Hubbard,
Thank you for your request for information relating to communications and
discussion with Lowfield Primary about London Rd/Broadfield Rd road
widening which we received on 10/01/2024.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 07/02/2024. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Ruth Hubbard,
Thank you for your request for information relating to communications and
discussion with Lowfield Primary about London Rd/Broadfield Rd road
widening which we received on 10/01/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Although there have been a number of changes of staff involved on this
project over the past seven years, we have searched both the project
folders and the general enquiries box for key words linked to Lowfield
School. The outcome is as follows:
• 19^th December 2017 – where the school was referenced as an example in
a communication from a resident in Woodseats, but it wasn’t in
relation to the Broadfield Road project.
• March 2019 - where the school was approached as part of a broader
consultation on the removal of the gantry system, Broadfield Road
widening and specific loading and waiting restrictions within the area
• 2019 report on the Woodhead Road closure scheme, where Lowfield school
was mentioned in an objection response, although the school was not
contacted directly with regards to this scheme (enclosed)
• 19^th July 2023 – response to Committee question (enclosed) The
details of individuals have been redacted under Regulation 12(3) of
the Environmental Information Regulations 2004 (EIR) and Regulation 13
EIR as amended by Sch. 19, para 307 of the Data Protection Act 2018,
which provide an exception for where the information requested
includes personal data of which the applicant is not the data subject
where disclosure would contravene the data protection principles of
the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Disclosure of the
information would contravene the data protection principle under
Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection Regulation that
processing of personal data must be fair, lawful and transparent.
More recently, Lowfield are also included as one of our key stakeholders,
with the address of [1][
email address
]. We have sent
them emails on:
• 27/09/2022 (General update on scheme)
• 06/02/2023 (Follow-up email to above)
• 09/05/2023 (Info on Northern Powergrid cable find)
• 09/06/2023 (Update on all parts of scheme)
• 14/06/2023 (Follow-up to above informing about utilities access
requirement)
• 08/11/2023 (Night working update 1)
• 30/11/2023 (Night working update 2)
A stakeholder email update was sent week commencing 22/01.They are also on
our postal address database for the scheme, so should have received all
mailouts we have sent them (we haven’t had any bouncebacks from them).
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see

https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
